net.hudup.core.client

Interface PowerServer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote, Server
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultServer, ExternalServer, PowerServerImpl

    public interface PowerServer
extends Server
    PowerServer is a powerful Server with advanced functions such as supporting balancing and retrieving service. For example, there is a counter inside ActiveMeasure. Note that ActiveMeasure interface specifies how to measure the active degree of PowerServer. Each time PowerServer receives a user request, the counter is increased by 1. After PowerServer finishes serving such user request, the counter is decreased by 1. If there are many PowerServer (s) deployed on different sites, balancer uses ActiveMeasure to determine which PowerServer is least busy in order to dispatch user request to such PowerServer whose active counter is smallest.
    Note, the sub-architecture of recommendation server (recommender) is inspired from the architecture of Oracle database management system (Oracle DBMS); especially concepts of listener and share memory layer are borrowed from concepts "Listener" and "System Global Area" of Oracle DBMS, respectively, available at https://docs.oracle.com/database/122/index.htm.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen

      • getActiveMeasure

        ActiveMeasure getActiveMeasure()
                        throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Getting the ActiveMeasure. ActiveMeasure interface specifies how to measure the active degree of PowerServer. The higher active degree is, the more busy the PowerServer is.
        Returns:
        ActiveMeasure.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

      • validateAccount

        boolean validateAccount(java.lang.String account,
                        java.lang.String password,
                        int privileges)
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Checking whether an account is valid with regard to specified password and specified privileges. Note, account is the information of a user who has access to Hudup server with her/his privileges. Account is modeled and stored in framework database as profile. Account is the information of a user who has access to the server with her/his privileges. Account is modeled and stored in framework database as profile.
        Parameters:
        account - specified account.
        password - specified password.
        privileges - specified privileges.
        Returns:
        whether account is valid.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

      • getService

        Service getService()
            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Each server is responsible for creating service represented by Service interface to serve user requests. In other words, each server own a service.
        Returns:
        Service the service own by this server.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.
